answers.answer: I would wonder whether you have an infectious mononucleosis, urticaria as an association.Your loss of weight is of concern and need to get investigated for sure.Connective tissue disorders need to be ruled out too,Best wishes.

Hello,Since the left side is getting numb, it is better to consult a physician or a neurologist and get nerve conduction velocity test to rule out any neurological cause or parasthesia skin. It can be due to diabetes, hypothyroidism, and hypoparathyroidism. They can also be due to vascular disease, vitamin B12 deficiency or malnutrition.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: Im 20 year old female. For the past 3 weeks ive had hives and extremely itchy skin. They have gotten worse and appear for 10 min then disappear and show up somewhere else. Then the past week ive had neck pain, which seems to be getting worse. My left side is swollen but im unsure if its my lymph node. also my left side of my neck i feel like i started to lose my sense of touch, i can feel when you touch it but it almost feels halfway numb. I also became very flushed a couple days ago, its felt like my skin was burning and i got extremely light headed and nausous. I drank water and rinsed my face and and 5 min later i was fine, like nothing happend. i havnt felt weak. i have lost 24 lbs the past 3 months, but i have also been working out and eating healthy. Ive also noticed the past two months i lose alot more hair in the shower then i use to.
title: Dont know who to go see about this
